instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
I have a 820-4924-A board, it turns on normally, but no display.

It displays image to an external monitor, but its own LCD remains black like it has not been plugged in the board.

L8300 5V appear in the first few seconds w/ or w/o LCD connected.

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT 0V always.

Just 5.1 V pin 3-4 J8300

threads.title: 820-4924-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
"L8300 5V appear in the first few seconds w/ or w/o LCD connected."
Check if LCD_HPD_CONN and DP_INT_HPD go both high at same time; LCD connected, of course.

Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: 820-4924-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
0 V always on  LCD_HPD_CONN and DP_INT_HPD

unfortunately I don't have a good LCD.

Anything else I can do?

I would not like to think that the PCH is damaged

threads.title: 820-4924-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
PCH expects DP_INT_HPD signal, prior to enable internal video.
Looks like you have a bad LCD...

threads.title: 820-4924-A no image, no backlight
threads.message: Tank you Sr. i'am wating for a new screen
